Give a talk

We are very happy that you are interested in giving a talk in SCPC. There are a few things you need to pay attention to:

Topic

In general, we welcome any kind of topic that is closely related to practical programming. In addition, the topic needs to be appropriate for the general audience (undergraduate students).

Here is a list of recommended topics:

  • introduction to a programming language or a library
  • a specific programming technique/algorithm
  • solution to a problem from ACM-ICPC
  • shout out for a project made by SLU students
  • any other topic you really like to talk about

If you are still unsure, feel free to checkout a list of talks given in the past: talk schedule.

Format

In order to apply to give a talk, you need to prepare the following basic information:

  • your name
  • your slu email
  • talk title
  • short description

Recommended (optional):

  • handout (pdf format recommended)
  • some code for audience to download and run. We recommend you to upload it to gist.github.com (Learn more about gist), but if you can't, just email us the code and we will take care of it for you.

Timeline

  1. Speaker submits application.
  2. We review the application. If not successful, we will tell the speaker what needs to be fixed, then the speaker needs to go to back to step 1.
  3. Speaker chooses the date to give the talk.
  4. We publish the updated schedule on our website.
  5. In case of emergency, we might have to cancel the talk and the speaker will then have to go back to step 3 to reschedule.
  6. Speaker gives the talk according to the schedule.

Website is written by Jiaqi Li. Back to top
